channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why the case against a Roth conversion gets stronger if Trump’s tax cuts continue
item.description: Break-even point for a Roth conversion is long —and extending the 2017 tax cuts could make it longer.

item.title: AppLovin’s S&P 500 snub could make for the stock’s worst day in two years
item.description: AppLovin’s $135 billion market cap and 900% year-to-date surge through Friday’s close weren’t enough to earn it entry into the benchmark large-cap ind...

item.title: Gold Futures Rise as China Central Bank Bullion Holdings Grow
item.description: Gold futures rise as China’s central bank resumes bullion purchases after a six-month hiatus.

item.title: The S&P 500 at 4,800? That’s what some Wall Street experts predicted — for 2024.
item.description: Your best stock-market advice for 2025? Pay no attention to stock-market predictions, which are frequently — and comically — wrong.

item.title: Dollar's Prospects Look Similar to Trump's 2016 Election Win
item.description: The dollar’s movements since Donald Trump’s U.S. presidential election victory in November appear remarkably similar to eight years ago when he won hi...

item.title: Nvidia reportedly facing China antitrust probe. Why that matters for the stock.
item.description: Nvidia’s stock heads for a third-straight decline after report of China’s investigation due to antitrust concerns.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Fall as China Probes Nvidia
item.description: U.S. stocks were slipping to start the week, with Nvidia under particular pressure after China announced an antitrust probe into the chip giant.

item.title: ESG Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Macy’s response to activist investors, Sartorius’s new CEO and more in the latest Market Talks covering ESG Impact Investing.

item.title: Get familiar with the market’s history. It’ll help you see what’s coming for stocks.
item.description: Some investing pros study the past. Others look ahead. Why it’s important to do both.

item.title: Eurozone Government Bond Supply Will Be Huge Again in 2025 But So Will Demand
item.description: Government bond supply in the eurozone will remain at very high levels in 2025, but analysts expect ample demand from investors seeking decent yields ...
